info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 6:27PM EDT until June 16 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM EDT FOR NORTHERN CENTRE AND SOUTHERN CLINTON COUNTIES... At 626 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Bald Eagle State Park, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Blanchard around 630 PM EDT. Lamar, Mackeyville and Mill Hall around 640 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Orviston, Howard, Beech Creek and Lock Haven University. For those driving on Interstate 80, this includes areas between the Bellefonte and Loganton exits, specifically from mile markers 163 to 182. This includes the following highways... Route 220 from west of Lamar on I-80 to Lock Haven. State Road 120 from north of Lock Haven to Lock Haven. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for central and north central Pennsylvania. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
